discourse_list.title: Why Doesnt Maker Build Its Own AMM?

content.content: Makerdao built the first decentralized exchange on Ethereum, oasisdex, which is still alive i believe. I bought some of my first Maker on Oasis. It is a bit clunky but it works. Had the design been just a little different, instead of an order book it had been an AMM imagine the powerhouse Maker would be today. It almost wouldnt be fair. Building Oasis was a massive effort. But the code is there now for an AMM dex. Why not build an official Maker version? Liquidity would be hard to come by but with some clever incentives the volume could be slowly increased.
content.GPT-summary: The author is proposing that Maker should build its own AMM (Automated Market Maker) decentralized exchange. The author explains that Maker already built the first decentralized exchange on Ethereum, Oasisdex, and suggests that if it had been designed as an AMM instead of an order book, Maker would be even more successful. The author suggests that Maker could slowly increase volume with clever incentives. A third party gives constructive criticism by suggesting that Maker should focus on its core business of stablecoins and not get distracted by building an AMM. Another third party extends the proposal by suggesting that Maker could collaborate with an existing AMM instead of building its own.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: It could be added to the roadmap down the line if the community thinks it’s worth while. Having base pairs in DAI that are provided with liquidity by the protocol would be awesome.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: There is a MIP open for it, based on uniswap code. MIP 31. For Dai/Mkr based on our liquidity. Feel free to add more requirement, idea on it.

Liquidity is already quite fragmented among so many different AMMs on base Ethereum. Let the other teams work on building great AMMs. We can just work on making sure there are DAI pairs on those AMMs.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Generally agree with this, staying in our lane is probably the best course of action (there’s so much work to be done just on our core protocol). But, it’s comforting to know that there’s a lot of open source code to draw from if available DEX platforms start to extract too much rent.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
